title: Quicksand Slab Serif
content:
I'm currently working on a slab serif based on my previous typeface Quicksand. I have two version at the moment, a rounded one which quite look like a typewriter font and the typical slab serif approach. As always, crits & suggestions appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417171719im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Q_Slab_3503.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417171719im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Slab-1_6484.jpg)
author: alienbreed

comments.content: The hook on the j is a bit too short and abrupt for my tastes, but that's what they are. Very good looking and solid overall. It strongly resembles Lubalin Graph, as any geometric slab-serif is likely to, but I think you noticed that too and included features to differentiate this. Am I right?

Just an optical reference for your C, G, Q and O: [http://www.typeworkshop.com/index.php?id1=type-basics&id2=&id3=&id4=&id5...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417171719/http:/www.typeworkshop.com/index.php?id1=type-basics&id2=&id3=&id4=&id5=&idpic=01#pictloader "http://www.typeworkshop.com/index.php?id1=type-basics&id2=&id3=&id4=&id5=&idpic=01#pictloader")

This is really neat. I prefer the roundy version.  
To my eyes, the F, J and W are too wide, the y has too many serifs (compare to the g or u), and the serifs on the V need to be pulled in closer.  
Hope that's helpful! :)
Maybe pull down the top end of the C, c, and G more, and/or shorten its serif?
